results.title: We are the Lambeth Boys
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Karel Reisz and Graphic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Britain”.
”Free cinema” documentary about the work and leisure time of a group of teenagers in an urban industrial community. Shot in and around a Kensington youth club, this film is pitched between social documentary and personal expression. Gives an idea of the realistic way in which the club is run, but concentrates on the young people themselves, their involvement with life, their problems and potentialities. While some comment is made, the young people are mostly left to speak for themselves, with their expressive hands, watchful eyes and the richness of their words. Commentary by Jon Rollason. Music by John Dankworth.

results.title: We are the city
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and New Document Productions
results.brief_description: A candid portrait of the city through the sights and sounds of its daily activities. We share in the bustle and excitement of its people as they walk to their jobs, enjoy leisure hours, strive to improve living conditions and frankly discuss their feelings and attitudes about city life.

results.title: We are one
results.brief_description:
A rhythmic montage-in-motion of children around the world - playing, running, dancing, crying, laughing, eating - with touching contrasts and funny similarities. The message is universal love and hope: modern skills give mankind the chance to make this one world.
Based on the NHK production by Akira Takasaka and Kuniji Kodama.

results.title: We are of the soil
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Iowa State University Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
Highlights the consequences of erosion due to wind, water and overworking of the soil, as well as outlining some possible erosion control techniques. Also considers with whom the responsibility for control of soil erosion lies.
Suitable for middle and uppeer secondary levels.

results.title: We are all alone my dear
results.brief_description: A compassionate study of aged women living in a retirement home through the observations of Jean Campbell as she moves from room to room talking with other inmates and discussing her experiences within the institution.

results.title: We all have our reasons
results.creator_credit: Iris Films, Frances Reid and Elizabeth Stevens
results.brief_description: We all have our reasons for drinking, yet seldom do we examine our reason. This film takes us into a group of women alcoholics whose sobriety ranges from one week to five years. We hear them talk about their experiences.

results.title: We've come a long way
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Anglo Iranian Oil Company
results.brief_description: Illustrates a century of progress in the design of oil tankers dating from the time when oil casks were first lashed in the holds of cargo vessels. The film explains how the problems of dealing with escaping gas and of increasing the weight of cargo without imposing too great a strain on the hull of the tanker, were ultimately solved.

results.title: We're not married!
results.creator_credit: Nunnally Johnson, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Edmund Goulding
results.brief_description: One Christmas a couple eager to earn a spot on the radio show, ‘Breakfast with the glad Gladwyns’ (the couple must be married to be believable), rush to get married by a newly appointed marriage celebrant. 2 years and 6 months later, the couple are rich, radio stars, but still bickering and unhappy and are delighted when they receive a letter in the mail saying they are not legally married. It appears that 6 couples married by the celebrant were not legal as he began practicing before his legal appointment. Thus, the couples are given a second chance at deciding whether or not they’re happy with the partner they’ve chosen and their life together so far. Couples contemplating their future include the unhappy radio performers (Ginger Rogers and Fred Allen), an aspiring Mrs America and her house husband (Marilyn Monroe and David Wayne), a philanderer and his wife who have run out of things to say (Eve Arden and Paul Douglas), a gold digger already beginning divorce proceedings (Zsa Zsa Gabor and Louis Calhern), and a soldier and his pregnant wife desperate to make their first born child legitimate (Mitzi Gaynor and Eddie Bracken). The 6th couple have already divorced. Features the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: We're no angels
results.creator_credit: Pat Duggan, Paramount Pictures and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Set in French Guiana, three convicts escape from the notorious prison on Devil’s Island and hide amongst the colonists. In need of clothing and money, the three make plans to rob a milliner, Felix, and his family. The trio are deterred from their larcenous intents when they develop a fondness for the family. Discovering that Felix is on the verge of bankruptcy, the convicts offer their services as household help. Matters are further complicated when they discover that Felix’s wealthy cousin arrives to audit the books. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Aldo Ray, Peter Ustinov, Joan Bennett and Basil Rathbone.
